reviewText:
Early Access Review

First of all this is NOT SPAZ 1, so toss that notion out the window.   Spaz 2 is a good game but I can see it dying off rather quickly without mods and expansions. I have beaten the campaign and started a sandbox mode and beat it and felt NOTHING different besides the sliders to increase or decrease difficulty, which means more or less grinding, everyone loves grinding right? I have read what the developers are focusing on, balance and hopefully multiplayer, so theres nothing new coming out when they fully release the game, sad.. I can see sooo many more weapons and modules and strike craft to add to the game, with a game like this those possibilities are almost endless.

ALpha Release rating 6/10 because very low replayability, beat the game twice and you would have done everything. In a game designed to be replayed multiple times, this is not a good sign.

Very impressive for a two person team, keep up the great work and I'll keep buying your games!!
This game is worth a look.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So...
I love this game.
But there is so much work to be done...
To all of you who would prefer direct sequel and because of this posted negative review - shame on you. I personally wanted direct 2D sequel with fixed mistakes, but devs should move forward and this move from 2D to 3D is the right way.
Sure, this game still have many troubles, but it's early access and devs carefully listening to fans to improve game as much as possible.
So, now to proper review: I divided it to big parts, at which I will compare SPAZ and SPAZ2.
___
- Graphics: 2D graphics were more refined. 3D looks better overall, but backgrounds and especially ship design looks bad now. I think bg is easy to fix, cause now some parts of it too much blurry, but design is what devs should look at asap. In mid-late ships become better and not looking like junk collection, and medium-large size parts really helping it, but it still looks worse then any SPAZ ship. I loved careful work on every, even smallest ship, so now, compared to old design, this looks really bad. I don't mind playing on new ships, because designing ships is cool feature too, and also can't see any way out of this situation, but devs should look up this problem. Overall effects is much better, so any part about graphics except ship design (ship parts aside designed really good still) and blurry background I love more in SPAZ2.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have been waiting 2.5 years for this game, I was not disappointed.

for now I have played 36 hours
I have completed the campaign and defeated the zombies in sandbox

the game:
there is never a dull moment, all the busywork from SPAZ 1 have been reworked and it works quite well.
the campaign contains a well written story and holds a casual disreguard towards human life, you are in a race against time, every captain that loses to a zombie becomes a zombie, and every zombie that is defeated simply respawns after a bit of time, if you are not on your toes the galaxy will soon be completely zombified.

bugs:
I experienced a few crashes but it just got out into early access so its to be expected.
In total I experienced 5 crashes in 36 hours, all of which has been reported and devs responded promptly

Early Access Review

Writing reviews is not my thing. but I wanted to give it a thumbs up.

when I started playing I saw that alot of things was changed from good ol' SPAZ, and initially that made me pretty sceptical, but as I played more and more of it, it really grew on me.

The dialog in the game is pretty funny.

The tools you get to customize your ship is almost on par with the original SPAZ, but it takes a while to see where it all is coming from. Buutt I have my fingers crossed for more weapon variants or armor :)

The core game is solid, there are some new systems" in play like reloading that really adds depth to the game

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Update:
So there have been a number of hotfixes which have added some control options and squashed the majority of CTDs, enough that I would now say its a worthwile purchase!
Still looking forward to a bit more content, but if the original SPAZ is any indicator that will be forthcoming.

Review after my first 6 Hours play:
Awful controls, really unintuitive somehow, even after 6 hours I'm wrestling with them all the time, would be nice if they added more options.
Lots of crashes to desktop, thankfully it auto saves though wish it did this slightly more offten whilst there are still so many CTD's.
Joining a battle seems a litle bit pontless currently (this could change later in the game), whenever I join a fight with another NPC against a bandit, the bandit always dies before I get even halfway to weapons range.
Prefer the old style tech tree and equipment, somehow just replacing parts, seems more limited.

All that said I can already see it has a lot of potential, and Whilst I would hold off buying for the moment I think it will be a great game once its had a bit more bug squishing and polish.
